Class ReservationDAO

java.lang.Object
DataBase.dao.ReservationDAO
public class ReservationDAO extends Object
Data Access Object for reservation management.

Handles the full reservation lifecycle including: creation, capacity checks, arrival validation, table allocation, cancellation, and expiration logic.

This class is used by both customer-facing flows and terminal/staff operations.

      public static void insertReservation(int numOfCustomers, Timestamp reservationTime, Timestamp expiryTime, String status, String confirmationCode) throws Exception
      Inserts a new reservation record into the database.
      Parameters:
      numOfCustomers - number of guests
      reservationTime - reservation start time
      expiryTime - reservation expiry time
      status - initial reservation status
      confirmationCode - unique confirmation code
      Throws:
      Exception - if database operation fails

    • createReservationWithActivity

      public ReservationDAO.CreateReservationResult createReservationWithActivity(MakeReservationRequestDTO req) throws Exception
      Creates a reservation and its matching user_activity entry within a single transaction.

      Performs capacity validation before insertion and generates a unique confirmation code.

      Parameters:
      req - reservation request data (subscriber or guest)
      Returns:
      created reservation id and confirmation code
      Throws:
      Exception - if capacity is exceeded or transaction fails

    • getBookedCustomersInRange

      public static int getBookedCustomersInRange(Connection conn, Timestamp start, Timestamp end) throws Exception
      Calculates the total number of guests already booked in a given time window.

      Counts only reservations that occupy capacity (CONFIRMED or ARRIVED).

      Parameters:
      conn - active database connection
      start - range start time
      end - range end time
      Returns:
      total number of booked guests
      Throws:
      Exception - on query failure

    • markArrivedByCodeReturnTableId

      public static String markArrivedByCodeReturnTableId(String code) throws Exception
      Marks a reservation as ARRIVED using its confirmation code.

      Validates time window, allocates or occupies tables, creates visit records and updates reservation status.

      Parameters:
      code - reservation confirmation code
      Returns:
      main allocated table id
      Throws:
      Exception - if check-in is not allowed or fails

      public static boolean cancelReservation(int reservationId, String role, String username, String guestEmail, String guestPhone) throws Exception
      Cancel a reservation (set status to CANCELLED) only if: - it belongs to the requester (subscriber_username OR guest_email+guest_phone in user_activity) - and reservation is still cancellable (currently CONFIRMED)
      Returns:
      true if the reservation was updated, false otherwise
      Throws:
      Exception

    • cancelReservationByCode

      public static ReservationDAO.CancelByCodeResult cancelReservationByCode(String confirmationCode) throws Exception
      Cancels a reservation by confirmation code.

      Allowed only for CONFIRMED or PENDING reservations. Also releases any reserved tables.

      Parameters:
      confirmationCode - reservation confirmation code
      Returns:
      result object with status and message
      Throws:
      Exception - on database failure

    • cancelConflictsAfterHoursUpdate

      public static List<String[]> cancelConflictsAfterHoursUpdate(String dayOfWeek, String specialDate, String newOpen, String newClose) throws Exception
      Identifies and cancels existing reservations that conflict with updated opening hours.

      This method queries for "CONFIRMED" reservations that are now invalid because:

      • They fall on the specific date (if provided) or day of the week.
      • Their time is before the new opening time.
      • Their time is too close to the new closing time (less than 2 hours before close).
      Any matching reservations are updated to "CANCELED".
      Parameters:
      dayOfWeek - the day of the week to check (e.g., "Monday")
      specialDate - a specific date string (YYYY-MM-DD) to check, or null for recurring weekly hours
      newOpen - the new opening time string (HH:mm)
      newClose - the new closing time string (HH:mm)
      Returns:
      a list of string arrays containing contact info for affected customers: [username, guestEmail, guestPhone]
      Throws:
      Exception - if a database access error occurs during query or update
